oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NUMERICAL SIMULATION OF THE IMPACT FORCES GENERATED BY A SWASH-TYPE FLOW ON AN OVERTOPPED OBSTACLE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rozki, Mohamed
Abadie, Stéphane
Morichon, Denis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The projected increase in sea levels will undoubtedly exacerbate the impact severity of storm events in the foreseeable future. In light of this, temporary protective measures are emerging as compelling alternatives to inflexible structures like breakwaters. However, the design and sizing of such temporary protections usually rely primarily on empirical approaches in the absence of well- established and comprehensive guidelines. The present study endeavors to address this deficiency and acquire a more profound understanding of the mechanical forces loading on these protective systems.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; currents.21
